description: Returns the number of closed workflow executions within the given domain that meet the specified filtering criteria. You can use IAM policies to control this action's access to Amazon SWF resources as follows: If the caller doesn't have sufficient permissions to invoke the action, or the parameter values fall outside the specified constraints, the action fails. The associated event attribute's cause parameter is set to OPERATION_NOT_PERMITTED. For details and example IAM policies, see Using IAM to Manage Access to Amazon SWF Workflows in the Amazon SWF Developer Guide.

parameters.name: domain
parameters.description: The name of the domain containing the workflow executions to count.

parameters.name: startTimeFilter
parameters.description: If specified, only workflow executions that meet the start time criteria of the filter are counted. Specifies the oldest start or close date and time to return. latestDate (datetime) --- Specifies the latest start or close date and time to return.

nested_params.name: oldestDate
nested_params.description: Specifies the oldest start or close date and time to return.

nested_params.name: latestDate
nested_params.description: Specifies the latest start or close date and time to return.

parameters.name: closeTimeFilter
parameters.description: If specified, only workflow executions that meet the close time criteria of the filter are counted. Specifies the oldest start or close date and time to return. latestDate (datetime) --- Specifies the latest start or close date and time to return.

nested_params.name: oldestDate
nested_params.description: Specifies the oldest start or close date and time to return.

nested_params.name: latestDate
nested_params.description: Specifies the latest start or close date and time to return.

parameters.name: executionFilter
parameters.description: If specified, only workflow executions matching the WorkflowId in the filter are counted. The workflowId to pass of match the criteria of this filter.

nested_params.name: workflowId
nested_params.description: The workflowId to pass of match the criteria of this filter.

parameters.name: typeFilter
parameters.description: If specified, indicates the type of the workflow executions to be counted. Name of the workflow type. version (string) --- Version of the workflow type.

parameters.name: tagFilter
parameters.description: If specified, only executions that have a tag that matches the filter are counted. Specifies the tag that must be associated with the execution for it to meet the filter criteria. Tags may only contain unicode letters, digits, whitespace, or these symbols: _ . : / = + - @.

nested_params.name: tag
nested_params.description: Specifies the tag that must be associated with the execution for it to meet the filter criteria. Tags may only contain unicode letters, digits, whitespace, or these symbols: _ . : / = + - @.

parameters.name: closeStatusFilter
parameters.description: If specified, only workflow executions that match this close status are counted. This filter has an affect only if executionStatus is specified as CLOSED. The close status that must match the close status of an execution for it to meet the criteria of this filter.

nested_params.name: status
nested_params.description: The close status that must match the close status of an execution for it to meet the criteria of this filter.

nested_items.name: truncated
nested_items.description: If set to true, indicates that the actual count was more than the maximum supported by this API and the count returned is the truncated value.
